definition-item.definition-title: PRODUCING, e.g. BY PRESSING RAW MATERIALS OR BY EXTRACTION FROM WASTE MATERIALS, REFINING OR PRESERVING FATS, FATTY SUBSTANCES, e.g. LANOLIN, FATTY OILS OR WAXES; ESSENTIAL OILS; PERFUMES (drying-oils C09F)

list-item.paragraph-text: Methods and apparatus for preparation of fats from raw material
Refining the fats; methods and apparatus thereof

section-body.paragraph-text: The various uses of fats for different purposes is classified in corresponding places (see references).
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Use of fats in foods in general
Use of fats in animal feeds

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Preparation of oxygen-containing organic compounds e.g. fats, fatty oils, ester-type waxes, oxidized oils or fats by processes using enzymes of microorganisms

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: A concentrated, hydrophobic liquid containing volatile aromatic compounds from plants.
Reaction between acid and alcohol resulting in ester bond.
Esters of glycerol and fatty acids, generally in solid form.
A carboxylic acid consisting of a hydrocarbon chain, which may have unsaturations and a terminal carboxyl group.
Chemical process that adds hydrogen atoms to a molecule.
Process by which one molecule is transformed into another molecule which has exactly the same atoms.
Organic compounds based on fatty acids, generally hydrophobic.
Fat which is in liquid form.
Any of a group of substances composed of hydrophobic hydrocarbons, alcohols, fatty acids, and esters that are solid at ambient temperatures.

abbreviations.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following abbreviations are often used:

definition-item.definition-title: Production of fats or fatty oils from raw materials
Pretreatment

section-body.paragraph-text: Processes for facilitating separation of fats/oils from sources.

definition-item.definition-title: {by enzymes or microorganisms, living or dead}

section-body.paragraph-text: Pretreatment with objective of facilitating separation essentially when enzyme mediated, either via direct addition or indirectly via microbes.

definition-item.definition-title: of vegetable raw material {(C11B1/025 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Separating from fats/oils sources which have cell walls.

definition-item.definition-title: by pressing

section-body.paragraph-text: Facilitating separation using extrusion, rollers, expressers, etc.

definition-item.definition-title: by hot pressing

section-body.paragraph-text: Facilitating separation by raising temperature or not cooling.

definition-item.definition-title: by extracting

section-body.paragraph-text: Separating from fats/oil sources using extractants (typically fluids)

definition-item.definition-title: {in counter-current; utilisation of an equipment wherein the material is conveyed by a screw}

section-body.paragraph-text: Separating from fats/oil sources when source and extractant move in opposite directions and use of extruders in combination with added extractant.

definition-item.definition-title: {using super critical gases or vapours}

section-body.paragraph-text: Separating from fats/oil sources with the aid of super- of near -critical fluids

definition-item.definition-title: {using ultra-sounds}

section-body.paragraph-text: Separating from fats/oil sources with the aid of sound above 20kHz.

definition-item.definition-title: {after-treatment, e.g. of miscellae}

section-body.paragraph-text: All post separation treatment of extraction media.

definition-item.definition-title: by melting out

section-body.paragraph-text: Separating from fats/oil sources with direct application of heat.

definition-item.definition-title: with hot water or aqueous solutions

section-body.paragraph-text: Separating from fats/oil sources with application of heat via water or solutions.

definition-item.definition-title: with steam

section-body.paragraph-text: Separating from fats/oil sources with application of heat via gaseous water.

definition-item.definition-title: Refining fats or fatty oils

section-body.paragraph-text: Undefined processes for removing undesired material from fats/oils.

definition-item.definition-title: {by a combination of two or more of the means hereafter}

section-body.paragraph-text: Processes for removing undesired material from fats/oil where a combination of processes is required.

definition-item.definition-title: {by enzymes or microorganisms, living or dead}

section-body.paragraph-text: Processes for removing undesired material from fats/oil where process is essentially enzyme mediated, either via direct addition or indirectly via microbes.

definition-item.definition-title: {by wave energy or electric current, e.g. electrodialysis}

section-body.paragraph-text: Processes for removing undesired material from fats/oil where process is based energy which has a frequency, e.g. sound or radiation.

definition-item.definition-title: {by extraction}

section-body.paragraph-text: Processes for removing undesired material from fats/oil where process uses fluids.

definition-item.definition-title: {by filtration, e.g. including ultra filtration, dialysis (C11B3/005 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Processes for removing undesired material from fats/oil where process depends on size retention.

definition-item.definition-title: by chemical reaction {(C11B3/003 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Processes for removing undesired material from fats/oil where process depends chemical change.

definition-item.definition-title: with acids

section-body.paragraph-text: Processes for removing undesired material from fats/oil where process depends chemical change influenced by acidic material or pH<7.

definition-item.definition-title: with bases

section-body.paragraph-text: Processes for removing undesired material from fats/oil where process depends chemical change influenced by alkaline material or pH>7.

definition-item.definition-title: with oxidising agents

section-body.paragraph-text: Processes for removing undesired material from fats/oil where process depends chemical change influenced by reactions involving removal of electrons, e.g. peroxy compounds or hypochlorites.

definition-item.definition-title: by adsorption

section-body.paragraph-text: Processes for removing undesired material from fats/oil where process depends physico-chemical attraction to solids, e.g. zeolites.
Classification is also made in group B01D15/08 insofar as subject matter of general interest relating to chromatography is concerned.

definition-item.definition-title: by distillation

section-body.paragraph-text: Processes for removing undesired material from fats/oil where process depends on change to gaseous phase, e.g. short path or wiped film.

definition-item.definition-title: with the use of indifferent gases or vapours, e.g. steam

section-body.paragraph-text: Processes for removing undesired material from fats/oil where process depends change to gaseous phase using steam as boiling point depressant.

definition-item.definition-title: by mechanical means

section-body.paragraph-text: Processes for removing undesired material from fats/oil where process depends on purely physical forces, e.g. gravity, decantation or centrifugation.

definition-item.definition-title: Preserving by using additives, e.g. anti-oxidants

section-body.paragraph-text: Prevention of deterioration of oils/fats by addition of substances.
In groups C11B5/0007 - C11B5/0092, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, a composition is classified in the last appropriate place.

definition-item.definition-title: {Organic substances}

section-body.paragraph-text: Prevention of deterioration of oils/fats by addition of carbon containing substances generally.

definition-item.definition-title: {Hydrocarbons}

section-body.paragraph-text: Prevention of deterioration of oils/fats by addition of substances having only C and H constituents.

definition-item.definition-title: {containing oxygen}

section-body.paragraph-text: Prevention of deterioration of oils/fats by addition of O containing substances, generally organic.

definition-item.definition-title: {Carboxylic acids; Their derivates}

section-body.paragraph-text: Prevention of deterioration of oils/fats by addition of substances containing COOH groups or anions, esters or salts thereof, e.g. acetate or fatty acids.

definition-item.definition-title: {Phenols; Their halogenated and aminated derivates, their salts, their esters with carboxylic acids}

section-body.paragraph-text: Prevention of deterioration of oils/fats by addition of substances containing hydroxy group (including deprotonated) attached to aromatic ring structure , e.g. quinones, tocols or polyphenols.

definition-item.definition-title: {containing nitrogen}

section-body.paragraph-text: Prevention of deterioration of oils/fats by addition of nitrogen containing substances, e.g. N2, peptides or amino acids.

definition-item.definition-title: {Amines or imines (C11B5/0035 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Prevention of deterioration of oils/fats by addition of substances with a free amine or imine groups.

definition-item.definition-title: {Amides or imides}

section-body.paragraph-text: Prevention of deterioration of oils/fats by addition of substances with free amide or imide group.

definition-item.definition-title: {Heterocyclic compounds containing nitrogen in the ring}
{containing halogens, sulfur or phosphorus (halogenated phenols C11B5/0035)}

section-body.paragraph-text: e.g. chloro, thio or methio compounds.

definition-item.definition-title: {Metal hydrides or organo-metallic compounds, i.e. organic compounds containing a metal-to-carbon link}

section-body.paragraph-text: e.g. butyltin, ferrocene or silica hydrides.

definition-item.definition-title: {Substances of natural origin of unknown constitution, f.i. plant extracts}

section-body.paragraph-text: e.g. rosemary, sage, garlic or tea.

definition-item.definition-title: {Mixtures}

section-body.paragraph-text: Prevention of deterioration of oils/fats by addition of known mixtures of substances.

definition-item.definition-title: Separation of mixtures of fats or fatty oils into their constituents, e.g. saturated oils from unsaturated oils

section-body.paragraph-text: Separation where the process is undefined.
In groups C11B7/0008 - C11B7/0091, in the absence of an indication to the contrary an invention is classified in the last appropriate place.

definition-item.definition-title: {by differences of solubilities, e.g. by extraction, by separation from a solution by means of anti-solvents (addition of a minor amount of solvent intended to lower the melting point C11B7/0083, C11B7/0091)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Separation of oils/fats where the process uses fluids and differential solubilities/miscibilities.

definition-item.definition-title: {in hydrocarbons or halogenated hydrocarbons (in pressure liquefied gases C11B7/005)}
{in solvents containing oxygen in their molecule}

section-body.paragraph-text: e.g. acetone, carboyxlic acid derivatives or alcohols.

definition-item.definition-title: {in solvents containing other heteroatoms in their molecule}
{in mixtures of individualized solvents (water is not taken into account)}
{in solvents used at superatmospheric pressures}
{in solvents or mixtures of solvents of different natures or compositions used in succession}

section-body.paragraph-text: e.g. solvent gradient systems or gas liquid mixtures.

definition-item.definition-title: {between two or more non-miscible solvent phases}
{by differences of melting or solidifying points}

section-body.paragraph-text: Separation of oils/fats where the process uses heating or cooling and exploits, e.g. winterizing or crystallizing.

definition-item.definition-title: {with addition of auxiliary substances, e.g. cristallisation promotors, filter aids, melting point depressors, (if a characterised solution is formed C11B7/0008)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Separation of oils/fats where the process uses separation additives, e.g. urea, chelation, salts or complexation.

definition-item.definition-title: {non-solvents, e.g. water wherein the fat or oil is dispersed account a more washing out of fractions is not taken into}
Essential oils; Perfumes

section-body.paragraph-text: Perfume compositions otherwise not falling under the subclasses C11B9/0003 - C11B9/0096; Essential oil compositions; testing methods for perfumes which are not characterized by the equipment used, e.g. sniffer tests.

Perfume compounds or compositions described as being suitable for flavouring applications are also classified under A23L27/00 - essential oils described as being suitable for flavouring applications are also classified under A23L27/12 or A23L27/13.
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Disinfection, sterilisation or deodorisation of air, e.g. air fresheners; air freshening methods
Formulations or additives for perfume preparations

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Spices; Flavouring agents or condiments; Artificial sweetening agents; Table salts; Dietetic salt substitutes; Preparation or treatment thereof
Essential oils from non-citrus fruit, used for flavouring applications
Essential oils from citrus fruit, used for flavouring applications
Preparation of hydrocarbons from one or more compounds, none of them being a hydrocarbon

section-body.paragraph-text: In C11B9/0003 - C11B9/0096, classify each compound under one class only, according to last place rule. All exemplified compounds to be classified.

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: {Compounds of unspecified constitution defined by the chemical reaction for their preparation}

section-body.paragraph-text: Reaction products of fragrant compounds with further chemical compounds, adapted to release the fragrant compound when later activated by e.g. heat.

table-column.paragraph-text: Perfume compounds in detergent compositions which generate a fragrance upon thermal or chemical activation

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Essential oils from non-citrus fruit, used for flavoring applications

section-body.paragraph-text: For pro-perfumes, the fragrance-generating precursor compound according to one of the classes C11B9/0007 - C11B9/0069 should also be classified.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fragrant compound obtained by reacting a fragrance-generating precursor compound, typically an aldehyde or ketone, with at least one additional compound

definition-item.definition-title: {Aliphatic compounds}

table-column.paragraph-text: Alicyclic ring compounds; Aromatic ring compounds; Heterocyclic ring compounds

definition-item.definition-title: {containing S}

section-body.paragraph-text: Aliphatic sulfur compounds, e.g. mercaptans or thiols.

definition-item.definition-title: {containing oxygen as the only heteroatom}

section-body.paragraph-text: Aliphatic compounds containing an oxygen atom, e.g. alcohols, ethers, aldehydes or ketones.

table-column.paragraph-text: Carboxylic acids; Salts or esters thereof

definition-item.definition-title: {containing nitrogen as the only heteroatom}

section-body.paragraph-text: Aliphatic compounds containing nitrogen atoms, e.g. amines or aminoalcohols.

definition-item.definition-title: {compounds containing an alicyclic ring not condensed with another ring}

section-body.paragraph-text: Aliphatic ring compounds, saturated or unsaturated, optionally with substituents bonded to the ring, these substituents may include heteroatoms, e.g. halogen atoms, hydroxy groups or ether linkages.

table-column.paragraph-text: Condensed rings; Spiro compounds; Aromatic ring compounds; Heterocyclic ring compounds

definition-item.definition-title: {the ring containing less than six carbon atoms}

section-body.paragraph-text: Compounds containing cyclopentane, cyclopentene, cyclobutane, cyclobutene or cyclopropane rings.

definition-item.definition-title: {the ring containing six carbon atoms}
{the ring containing more than six carbon atoms}

section-body.paragraph-text: Cycloheptane; Cycloheptene or larger ring compounds.

definition-item.definition-title: {both rings being six-membered}
{compounds containing a six-membered aromatic ring not condensed with another ring}

table-column.paragraph-text: Spiro compounds containing a heterocyclic ring system which has only O or S as ring heteroatoms

definition-item.definition-title: Recovery or refining of essential oils from raw materials

table-column.paragraph-text: Essential oil compositions for perfume applications

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Recovery of essential oils intended for flavoring applications only

definition-item.definition-title: {Refining}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Refining and purification of essential oils, e.g. for removing unwanted constituents such as allergens.

definition-item.definition-title: {Recovery by solvent extraction}

section-body.paragraph-text: Extraction of essential oils from raw materials using an organic solvent or an inorganic solvent, e.g. water or supercritical CO2.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Solvent extraction of natural raw materials to produce flavorings

definition-item.definition-title: {Recovery of volatiles by distillation or stripping}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Distilling, stripping or recovering volatile compounds intended for flavoring applications

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Removal of volatile compounds from a liquid stream by a vapour stream, typically steam or a heated gas

definition-item.definition-title: Recovery or refining of other fatty substances, e.g. lanolin or waxes

section-body.paragraph-text: Specific cases of recovery and refining of non-glyceride material containing fatty acids.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions of oils, fats or waxes; Compositions of derivatives thereof
Recovery or refining of mineral waxes

definition-item.definition-title: Recovery of fats, fatty oils or fatty acids from waste materials

section-body.paragraph-text: Separating greasy materials, e.g. trap grease, yellow grease or used cooking oil from refuse, garbage or rubbish.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Treatment of water, waste water, sewage or sludge

definition-item.definition-title: {of residues of the fabrication of wood-cellulose (in particular tall-oil)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Recovery of fats, fatty oils or fatty acidsobtained as by-products of wood-cellulose process, e.g. rosin.

definition-item.definition-title: from soap stock

section-body.paragraph-text: Recovery or refining of fats/oils from aqueous caustic refining by-product.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: a by-product of vegetable oil refinement, containing lipids, fatty oils and salts.

definition-item.definition-title: from spent adsorption materials

section-body.paragraph-text: Recovery of fats, fatty oils or fatty acids from used adhered substances, e.g from filter cake, bleaching earths.

definition-item.definition-title: Solidifying fatty oils, fats, or waxes by physical processes

section-body.paragraph-text: Coagulating fatty oils, fats or waxes by non-chemical processes, e.g. prilling, coating.
